She knew her daughter was in the World Cup, but was not allowed to tell
Handball player Moa H√∂gdahl waited excitedly all Sunday. At 22, the important phone came.
04 Nov 2019, 14:53 by Mette Bugge
Then it was national team coach Thorir Hergeirsson who called. He asked how the Viborg player was.
- I just joked with him, but hoped he could tell quickly if I came or not, the 23-year-old laughs.
What she and all the other World Cup players were waiting for was the announcement of the withdrawal to the World Cup in Japan.

Here is Norway's World Cup squad

- It is the day of the year that you are only near the cellphone. It was a great relief to know that I was taken out. I cheered on the phone, because I couldn't hold back. It just came as a reaction, says the backer, who is making his championship debut in the city of Kumamoto. So should you mom.
Swedish Mia Hermansson H√∂gdahl (54), formerly named the world's best handball player, twice winner of the Champions League with Hypo Nieder√∂sterreich, six series and cup championships with By√•sen and eight Austrian titles, is national team coach in Hergeirsson's team.
She knew in advance that it was not she who would tell her daughter that she was among the chosen ones.


- Are you incompetent at the withdrawal of your daughter?


- All parents are incompetent when it comes to their children, but we work professionally. At the gathering you sit in a special mode. Then she is any player. When it comes to coaching her, Thorir and Mats (Olsson) take care of it. The others will take care of this. As a mom, I am proud and happy on her behalf. Like the others, she dreams of representing her team.

Reactions to the World Cup: - It came as a small shock



When Norway played a tournament at home in Stavanger in September, Moa H√∏gdahl was included. It provided a clue to the World Cup withdrawals. Here on the bench with mom.üì∑ Vidar Ruud


Facts: World Cup squad:
Goalies: Silje Solberg (Siofok), Andrea A. Pedersen (Vipers Kristiansand).
Performers: Emilie Hegh Arntzen (Vipers Kristiansand), Heidi L√∏ke (Vipers Kristiansand), Silje Waade (Vipers Kristiansand), Stine Bredal Oftedal (Gy√∂r), Malin Aune (Vipers Kristiansand), Kari Brattset Dale (Gy√∂r), Helene Gigstad Fauske -Ikast), Moa H√∂gdahl (Viborg), Marit R√∏sberg Jacobsen (Esbjerg), Ingvild Bakkerud (Odense), Camilla Herrem (Sola), Sanna Solberg (Esbjerg), Marta Tomac (Vipers Kristiansand), Stine Skogrand (Herning-Ikast).
Reserves: Kristine Breist√∏l (Esbjerg), Tonje Enkerud (Storhamar), Emily Stang Sando (Buducnost).


Norway plays in Group A in Kumamoto and meets Cuba (30/11), Slovenia (2/12), Serbia (3/12), Angola (5/12) and the Netherlands (6/12).




The main round runs from 8/11/11. The semi-finals are played 13/12 and bronze match and final 15/12. (NTB)



No doubt about the roles
Thorir Hergeirsson added 16 plus three names (travelers reserves) to the list on Monday. He says the division of labor is clear. It was he and Mats Olsson who made the decision in the selection of Moa, and they follow her up.
Hergeirsson says that the Tronder, with parents who have both been active and have long experience as coaches, is himself a modern player who has a good shot from the floor and the air - but first of all is described as a playing back player.
- She is wise and adapts to the game quickly. Moreover, she is in a fantastic defense development and she is still young in the international context.


Now the names are going out. Mia Hermansson H√∂gdahl and Thorir Hergeirsson joined the World Cup squad at Monday's press conference.üì∑ Ole Berg-Rusten

Moa H√∂gdahl hopes and believes that she can help to create flow in the defensive game. She was already in the hall for four months, and although she was influenced by the choice of handball as a sport, only she herself decides how far she has come.
Tr√∏nder is in his second season in Denmark, and has two series matches before the national team meets on November 18 in Norway, the day before departure for Japan.
On Tuesday night, Viborg will meet Herning-Ikast. There, among others, plays the fresh mum Stine Skogrand, who was also taken out to the World Cup.

She was Norway's World Cup joker - got a place in the squad

- It was cool. I am really looking forward, ‚Äùcomments the left-handed back player, who brings mom as a child care for the little son born in May. The two must be halfway.
On her club team also plays Helene Gigstad Fauske (22), who got a little taste of championship life in the previous World Cup, when it became silver. Now she has much more experience.
